candidates.name: Peter Wakeman
candidates.why_elect: Been an airline pilot, manager and grew up on a farm so understand the need for nature.
candidates.why_stand: Council out of control in spending and planning. Funding from Government needed to bail out Christchurch. Mayor Council Fendalton Ward and CDHB. A better way of eating fresh plants needs Council help.

candidates.name: Aaron White
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in Christchurch East all my life and have sat on a few committees in various roles. I have been a leader within youth organisations and been involved in organising events with the communities.
candidates.why_stand: I am running because Christchurch is my home and I want to see residents get their voices back and see progress is made in our city for our future generations.

candidates.name: JT Anderson
candidates.why_elect: As an Entrepreneur, I specialize in bouncing back from adversity, it's fun for me—People need to understand that Christchurch is in big trouble, financially, emotionally, psychically, geologically. It is going to take the heart, grit and hustle of a underdog like me to turn this city around.
candidates.why_stand: The Mayor and CCC have let our city down and quite frankly the people of Christchurch have had enough—I am here to sort it out and stand up for the people of Christchurch—I am standing on our biggest issues, because someone needs to.

candidates.name: Lianne Dalziel
candidates.why_elect: My background and experience, together with an inclusive leadership style, engages people from diverse backgrounds to come together, so we can make decisions that are "best for Christchurch".
candidates.why_stand: I want to make sure Christchurch seizes every opportunity to be the best place to live, work and play. I want us to be a city of opportunity for all—no matter who we are, where we are from, or how old we are.

candidates.name: Jim Glass
candidates.why_elect: I have managed my own affairs well.

candidates.name: Robin McCarthy
candidates.why_elect: As a long time tour operator I interact with thousands of people every year. I am also a long time employer and have worked and travelled extensively throughout the world. I have chaired many meetings.
candidates.why_stand: I have set up many businesses and continue to do so. The Christchurch City Council is difficult, costly and timely to deal with. They do so to protect incumbents from competition. That is not their role. I want to see people given at least a chance.

candidates.name: Stephen McPaike
candidates.why_elect: I am one of the youngest mayoral candidates in this year's election at the age of 34. I work in retail, which shows that I am hard working and I can budget and spend wisely. I am honest, loyal and passionate about the issues that are close to my community.
candidates.why_stand: I was walking through our CBD with my son during school holidays. He asked me "Why is this site empty? And this one?" I came to realise that my son has never seen a fully working city and I wanted to make a change for my son.

candidates.name: John Minto
candidates.why_elect: I have the fortitude to resist pressure from vested interests which traditionally run policy at local council level.
candidates.why_stand: Because Christchurch faces three big challenges which the current council is not dealing with. These are the climate emergency, water quality and crippling economic and social inequality.

candidates.name: Adrian-Cosmin Schönborn
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in this city for almost 15 years now and I have a good understanding of the structure and people's needs.
candidates.why_stand: Christchurch city and his people are part of me. I believe our city is the best in NZ.
